intro: Freycinetia formosana var. boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin freycinetia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the palms family, Arecaceae, and is characterized by its slender, clustered growth habit. The plant features pinnate leaves with a bluish-green hue and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles. Its fruits are fibrous and contain a single seed, typical of many palm species. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
